credit_line: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
title: Justice, Vaulted Ceiling Design, Palazzo Quirinale, Rome
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
medium: Pen and dark gray ink, brush and gray wash over black chalk ruled lines on light greenish-beige wove paper
description: Panel of trapezoidal ceiling vault with horizontal octagon of Justice sitting between putto with fasces and putto with book, flanked by tondi of Victories in chariots.
name: Drawing
